newsitem.title: USA: Transcrypt in due diligence on EF Johnson.
newsitem.headline: Transcrypt in due diligence on EF Johnson.

text.p: Transcrypt International Inc, after reporting higher second-quarter sales and profits, said Tuesday that it is continuing its due diligence process regarding the acquisition of EF Johnson Co

The company said it is continuing to negotiate a potential definitive agreement to acquire either stock or assets of Johnson. "Transcrypt does not know at this time when, if at all, a definitive agreement will be reached, to acquire either the stock or assets of E.F. Johnson," it said.
Transcrypt makes radio scrambling and encryption devices. Johnson, of Waseca, Minn., makes similar products.

Transcrypt said second-quarter revenue rose $5.6 million versus $3.1 million in the second quarter of 1996, while net income increased to $976,000 versus proforma net income of $412,000 for the second quarter of 1996.
Shares in Transcrypt closed Tuesday up 1-1/2 at 13-1/8 in over-the-counter trading.
